content.description: Second line in the corridor. Shares anchors with Limestone Cowboy.
content.protection: 7 bolts, 2 bolt anchor, no rap rings
content.location: Second line in the shooting gallery from the left, next to Epic in the Bottle.

content.description: Similar climbing, although slightly easier than its neighbor to the right, Gold Rush.  Crux is about 2/3 of the way up.  Shares anchors with Gold Rush.
Similar climbing, though slightly harder than it's neighbors to the right (Stumble In My Footsteps and Epic In A Bottle).  No specific crux, just lots of devious holds and a little pump management.
content.protection: 9 bolts.  Shares anchors with Stumble In My Footsteps.
content.location: Third route from the left when entering the upper Shooting Gallery.

content.description: Mixed route in the middle of the wall.  Starts with ~30 feet of intermittent crack systems to a bolted headwall.  Crux about 1/2 the way up moving left around a blankish sections.  The gear section is a little sporty but the upper part is worth it.
content.location: Look for a vague crack system with a first bolt ~30 feet off the deck.

content.description: Follow the golden water streak up the center of the Shooting Gallery. A steep start leads to a reachy crux at the third bolt. The rest of the climb is pump-management and route finding, there's always a jug to be found...
content.location: Second route from the right, just left of Bambi Slayer. Starts off the second wooden ledge.

content.description: Sharp holds up six (some hidden) bolts.  If the climb starts to full run out, you probably missed one of the bolts.  This is the leftmost route on the upper shooting gallery, the first you come to if you are approaching from The Boardwalk.
content.protection: Six bolts to two bolt anchor.  No rap rings.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on the upper shooting gallery, the first you come to if you are approaching from The Boardwalk.

climbs.name: Bambi Slayer
climbs.fa: Sean Leary and Cedar Wright, October 1996

content.description: Bambi Slayer is one of the "early" routes at the Aretes. This is the type of stone you traveled all that way for. As soon as you step off the ground this climb hits you full on. The "ground" at this point is a ledge 80 feet above the base of the Visions Wall. Pull out and onto the wall with insecure lie backs to increasingly better holds. The crux of Bambi is getting past the second bolt. Even though the crux is behind you, the climbing never lets up. This is gently overhanging, well featured limestone-sucker holds abound, but there is always another jug coming up. Make it through the pump and you'll be rewarded by a huge view 150 feet off the deck. Many consider this route 11a but the First Ascentionists rated it 10d. The FA was done ground up with 40 foot falls taken by both members of the first ascent party, including one head first when a hook blew. They added more bolts later to make it a fun adventure. Great exposure!
content.location:
Bambi Slayer is the farthest right route in the Upper Shooting Gallery. For added fun, climb the

Shard

and step right to the ledge and then launch up Bambi Slayer for a 150' route(17 draws).
